trans-unit.source: Configure Load balancer for SQL always on | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Configure Load balancer for SQL always on | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Configure Load balancer to work with SQL always on and how to leverage powershell to create load balancer for the SQL implementation
trans-unit.target: Configure Load balancer to work with SQL always on and how to leverage powershell to create load balancer for the SQL implementation

trans-unit.source: Configure load balancer for SQL always on
trans-unit.target: Configure load balancer for SQL always on

trans-unit.source: SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Groups can now be run with ILB.
trans-unit.target: SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Groups can now be run with ILB.

trans-unit.source: Availability Group is SQL Server’s flagship solution for high availability and disaster recovery.
trans-unit.target: Availability Group is SQL Server’s flagship solution for high availability and disaster recovery.

trans-unit.source: The Availability Group Listener allows client applications to seamlessly connect to the primary replica, irrespective of the number of the replicas in the configuration.
trans-unit.target: The Availability Group Listener allows client applications to seamlessly connect to the primary replica, irrespective of the number of the replicas in the configuration.

trans-unit.source: The listener (DNS) name is mapped to a load-balanced IP address and Azure’s load balancer directs the incoming traffic to only the primary server in the replica set.
trans-unit.target: The listener (DNS) name is mapped to a load-balanced IP address and Azure’s load balancer directs the incoming traffic to only the primary server in the replica set.

trans-unit.source: You can use ILB support for SQL Server AlwaysOn (listener) endpoints.
trans-unit.target: You can use ILB support for SQL Server AlwaysOn (listener) endpoints.

trans-unit.source: You now have control over the accessibility of the listener and can choose the load-balanced IP address from a specific subnet in your Virtual Network (VNet).
trans-unit.target: You now have control over the accessibility of the listener and can choose the load-balanced IP address from a specific subnet in your Virtual Network (VNet).

trans-unit.source: By using ILB on the listener, the SQL server endpoint (e.g. Server=tcp:ListenerName,1433;Database=DatabaseName) is accessible only by:
trans-unit.target: By using ILB on the listener, the SQL server endpoint (e.g. Server=tcp:ListenerName,1433;Database=DatabaseName) is accessible only by:

trans-unit.source: Services and VMs in the same Virtual network
trans-unit.target: Services and VMs in the same Virtual network

trans-unit.source: Services and VMs from connected on-premises network
trans-unit.target: Services and VMs from connected on-premises network

trans-unit.source: Services and VMs from inter connected VNets
trans-unit.target: Services and VMs from inter connected VNets

trans-unit.source: ILB_SQLAO_NewPic
trans-unit.target: ILB_SQLAO_NewPic

trans-unit.source: Internal Load balancer can only be configured through PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Internal Load balancer can only be configured through PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Add Internal Load Balancer to the service
trans-unit.target: Add Internal Load Balancer to the service

trans-unit.source: Step 1.
trans-unit.target: Step 1.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, we will configure a Virtual network that contains a subnet called ‘Subnet-1’:
trans-unit.target: In the following example, we will configure a Virtual network that contains a subnet called ‘Subnet-1’:

trans-unit.source: Step 2.
trans-unit.target: Step 2.

trans-unit.source: Add load balanced endpoints for ILB on each VM
trans-unit.target: Add load balanced endpoints for ILB on each VM

trans-unit.source: In the example above, you have 2 VM's called "sqlsvc1" and "sqlsvc2" running in the cloud service "Sqlsvc".
trans-unit.target: In the example above, you have 2 VM's called "sqlsvc1" and "sqlsvc2" running in the cloud service "Sqlsvc".

trans-unit.source: After creating the ILB with "DirectServerReturn" switch, you will add load balanced endpoints to the ILB to allow SQL to configure the listeners for the availability groups.
trans-unit.target: After creating the ILB with "DirectServerReturn" switch, you will add load balanced endpoints to the ILB to allow SQL to configure the listeners for the availability groups.

trans-unit.source: You can find more details creating a SQL Alwayson in [Tutorial: AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn249504.aspx) or [Using the Portal Gallery](http://blogs.technet.com/b/dataplatforminsider/archive/2014/08/25/sql-server-alwayson-offering-in-microsoft-azure-portal-gallery.aspx).
trans-unit.target: You can find more details creating a SQL Alwayson in [Tutorial: AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn249504.aspx) or [Using the Portal Gallery](http://blogs.technet.com/b/dataplatforminsider/archive/2014/08/25/sql-server-alwayson-offering-in-microsoft-azure-portal-gallery.aspx).
